item.item: This number is the unique identifier of the unit described. This number should not be duplicated or reassigned to another unit.
Unit number from the national registry.
Total surface area of the unit in hectares accuracy of 0.1 ha.
This type assesses the ownership of the unit.
Type and function of the unit
This type assesses the type of the unit.
Forest area managed for wood production and /or multiple uses and services
Date in which the unit data was collected, the date should be expressed in <kbd>YYYYMMDD</kbd> format, where day and month may be omitted.
Date of the most recent visit
Date in which the unit data last visited, the date should be expressed in <kbd>YYYYMMDD</kbd> format, where day and month may be omitted.
Remarks on specific soil characteristics of the unit.
Remarks on other specific characteristics of the unit.
All tree species growing in the unit
List of target and non target species growing in the unit.
Information on population target species growing in the unit.
Date of establishment of the gene conservation unit for the taxon.
Date of the most recent visit.
Status of the target tree population regarding the EUFORGEN common action plans.
This type assesses the status of the population.
This type assesses the situ of the population.
This type assesses the origin of the population.
This type assesses the silvicultural system of the population.
Level of management allowed to favour the target species.
This type assesses the management of the population.
Conservation through active intervention carried out
Main reason for carrying out gene conservation for this taxon.
This type assesses the justification for the population.
To maintain genetic diversity in large tree populations
To conserve specific adaptive and/or phenotypic traits in marginal or scattered tree populations which are often relatively small
To conserve rare or endangered tree species with populations consisting of a low number of remaining individuals
Total number of reproducing trees per unit.
This type assesses the number of reproducing trees in the population.
This type assesses the sex ratio in the population.
This type assesses the long-term regeneration status of the population.
Distribution of the reproducing trees in the unit
This type assesses the distribution of the population.
Estimated share of the total area within the unit in which the species is occurring
Expressed as a percentage, from 0 to 100.
